intro: Geum elatum var. leiocarpum, commonly known as the showy buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features showy, bright yellow flowers with a distinctive, cup-shaped bloom that appears in late spring to early summer. The plant has alternate, palmately lobed leaves that are typically hairy and covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, rich soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens. Its botanical characteristics make it both ornamental and ecologically valuable in native plant landscapes.
